intro: Schmaltzia glauca, commonly known as the blue schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Schmaltzia glauca is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
